|strength2 = |strength3 = |casualties1 = |casualties2 = |casualties3 = |notes = |campaignbox = {{Campaignbox 2014 pro-Russian conflict in Ukraine}} }} The '''battle in [[Shakhtarsk Raion]]''' began on 16 July 2014, when the [[Armed Forces of Ukraine]] began an attempt to cut off insurgent supply lines from Russia. Fighting broke out around the towns of Marynivka, [[Dmytrivka, Donetsk Oblast|Dmytrivka]], [[Stepanivka]], [[Shakhtarsk]], and also the strategic hill of [[Savur-Mohyla]]. It later spread to the cities of [[Snizhne]] and [[Torez]]. While the battle was in progress, a civilian passenger airliner, [[Malaysia Airlines Flight 17]], was shot down near [[Hrabove, Donetsk Oblast|Hrabove]]. Amidst a wide counter-offensive by the insurgents and their [[2014 Russian military intervention in Ukraine|Russian backers]] across Donbass, government troops were forced out of Shakhtarsk Raion on 26 August. ==Events by location== From 6 April, as part of the [[2014 pro-Russian unrest in Ukraine|rising unrest]] in Ukraine in the aftermath of the [[2014 Ukrainian revolution]], insurgents affiliated with the [[Donetsk People's Republic]] (DPR) captured towns and cities across [[Donetsk Oblast]], including Shakhtarsk Raion. The raion is in a crucial position between the Donetsk and Lugansk People's Republics, and Russia. Government forces launched an offensive against insurgent forces in Donetsk and Luhansk oblasts of Ukraine on 7 April, resulting in the [[War in Donbass]]. War reached Shakhtarsk Raion on 16 July, after insurgents retreated from most of northern Donetsk Oblast. Fighting took place across the raion, in an attempt by the government to cut-off insurgent supply lines, and to reach the crash site of [[Malaysia Airlines Flight 17]]. ===Stepanivka=== DPR-affiliated insurgents launched an offensive on neighbouring government-controlled Marynivka from village of [[Stepanivka]] on 16 July.{{cite news|url=http://video.news.rin.ru/eng/news/45344/ |title=The national guard under: militia attacked the Stepanovka under Donetsk |date=16 July 2014 |work=RIN.ru |accessdate=10 August 2014 |archivedate=12 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140812204205/http://video.news.rin.ru/eng/news/45344/ |deadurl=no |df=dmy }} Ukrainian forces said that they retook Stepanivka from the insurgents on 29 July, and then advanced towards nearby [[Pervomaisk, Luhansk Oblast|Pervomaisk]].{{cite news|author= |title=Stepanivka Is Liberated. Fighting for Snizhne and Pervomaisk Continue |url=http://en.censor.net.ua/news/295833/stepanivka_is_liberated_fighting_for_snizhne_and_pervomaisk_continue |publisher=censor.net |date=29 July 2014 |accessdate=4 August 2014 |archivedate=12 August 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140812195502/http://en.censor.net.ua/news/295833/stepanivka_is_liberated_fighting_for_snizhne_and_pervomaisk_continue |df=dmy }} According to an 11 August report, the village appeared have been almost completely destroyed by shelling during the fighting across the raion.{{cite news|url=http://un.ua/eng/article/526049.html |title=Antiterrorist Operation Took Lives of 568 Ukrainian Militaries, 2,120 Wounded |date=11 August 2014 |work=Ukrainian News |accessdate=11 August 2014 |archivedate=12 August 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140812210835/http://un.ua/eng/article/526049.html |df=dmy }} Stepanivka returned to insurgent control on 14 August.{{cite news|url=http://www.mk.ru/politics/2014/08/14/dnr-opolchency-otbili-u-silovikov-selo-stepanovka-na-granice-s-rossiey.html|title=ДНР: Ополченцы отбили у силовиков село Степановка на границе с Россией|date=14 August 2014|accessdate=17 August 2014|newspaper=[[Moskovskij Komsomolets]]}} ===Marynivka=== Marynivka is a border town located in the southern Donetsk Oblast. Its position on the border made control of it important to maintaining insurgent supply-lines. Insurgents launched an offensive on [[National Guard of Ukraine]] positions in the town on 16 July, after breaking through encirclement by government forces in neighbouring Stepanivka.{{cite news|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2014/07/16/us-ukraine-crisis-idUSKBN0FL0K020140716 |title=More Ukrainian soldiers killed as fighting rages in east, peace move flops |last1=Balmforth |first1=Richard |last2=Zverev |first2=Anton |date=16 July 2014 |agency=Reuters |accessdate=22 August 2014 |archivedate=26 July 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140726053242/http://www.reuters.com/article/2014/07/16/us-ukraine-crisis-idUSKBN0FL0K020140716 |df=dmy }} Fighting also spread to the nearby village of Tarany.{{cite news|author= |title=Militants attack National Guard positions in Donetsk oblast |url=http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/militants-attack-national-guard-positions-in-donetsk-oblast-356258.html |newspaper=[[Kyiv Post]] |agency=Interfax-Ukraine |date=16 July 2014 |accessdate=3 August 2014 |archivedate=17 July 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140717220818/http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine/militants-attack-national-guard-positions-in-donetsk-oblast-356258.html |df=dmy }} During this offensive, the insurgents used tanks, mortars, and anti-tank missiles against government forces. Insurgents held Marynivka until the National Guard was able to repel their offensive and force them to retreat to Stepanivka.{{cite news|url=http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/213817.html |title=Militants attack National Guard positions in Donetsk region |date=16 July 2014 |agency=Interfax-Ukraine |accessdate=11 August 2014 |archivedate=25 July 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140725132632/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/213817.html |df=dmy }} Later on, the insurgents said that had recaptured Marynivka.{{cite news|author= |title=Associated Press: Ukraine rebels reclaim village on Russian border |date=16 July 2014 |url=http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine-abroad/associated-press-ukraine-rebels-reclaim-village-on-russian-border-356307.html |agency=[[Associated Press]] |newspaper=Kyiv Post |accessdate=3 August 2014 |archivedate=21 July 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140721063639/http://www.kyivpost.com/content/ukraine-abroad/associated-press-ukraine-rebels-reclaim-village-on-russian-border-356307.html |place=Donetsk |df=dmy }} Insurgent spokesman Sergei Kavtaradze said that one insurgent had been killed, while fifteen were injured. Insurgent commander [[Igor Girkin]] said that DPR insurgents destroyed two Ukrainian armoured vehicles and captured one.{{cite news|url=http://news.yahoo.com/ukraine-rebels-reclaim-village-russian-border-130530741.html |title=Ukraine rebels reclaim village on Russian border |last=Chernov |first=Mstyslav |date=16 July 2014 |agency=Associated Press |work=[[Yahoo! News]] |accessdate=11 August 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140812151145/http://news.yahoo.com/ukraine-rebels-reclaim-village-russian-border-130530741.html |archivedate=12 August 2014 |df=dmy }} Ukrainian forces came under continued attack by the insurgents in Marynivka, despite managing to hold onto control of it on 16 July. On the day after the first insurgent offensive, government forces repelled another four attacks, and destroyed three tanks, two armoured personnel carriers, and two other combat vehicles.{{cite news|url=http://lifeinua.info/tymchuck-in-the-battle-near-marynivka-the-ato-forces-destroyed-3-tanks-2-apc-armoured-personnel-carriers-and-terrorists-cars/ |title=Tymchuck: In the battle near Marynivka the ATO forces destroyed 3 tanks, 2 APC (armoured personnel carriers) and terrorists’ cars |date=17 July 2014 |work=Life UA |accessdate=11 August 2014 |archivedate=12 August 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140812215055/http://lifeinua.info/tymchuck-in-the-battle-near-marynivka-the-ato-forces-destroyed-3-tanks-2-apc-armoured-personnel-carriers-and-terrorists-cars/ |df=dmy }} Mortar fire from Russia rained down on the Marynivka border crossing on 25 July. Government forces said they shot down at least three Russian [[unmanned aerial vehicle]]s on the same day.{{cite news|url=http://www.pentictonherald.ca/news/world_news/article_26aa178c-67c5-5170-8834-2e22bed58dab.html|title=US says Russia is firing across the border into Ukraine and moving in heavy artillery|date=25 July 2014|newspaper=[[Penticton Herald]]|accessdate=11 August 2014}} Insurgents said that they left the area on 31 July, after near-constant fighting with government forces.{{cite news|url=http://en.itar-tass.com/world/743106 |title=Ukrainian army intensifies offensive on Donetsk |date=31 July 2014 |accessdate=6 August 2014 |agency=[[Information Telegraph Agency of Russia|ITAR-TASS]] |archivedate=12 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140812223736/http://en.itar-tass.com/world/743106 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy }} Despite this, Ukrainian positions in and around Marynivka were shelled by [[Grad rockets]] and mortars on 1 August.{{cite news|url=http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/216448.html |title=Kyiv source claims Ukrainian paratroopers were ambushed by militants near Shakhtarsk |date=1 August 2014 |agency=Interfax-Ukraine |accessdate=11 August 2014 |archivedate=12 August 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140812224127/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/216448.html |df=dmy }} Insurgents launched a new offensive on Marynivka on 14 August. After fierce fighting with government forces in the vicinity of the border crossing, the town was captured by the insurgents.{{cite news|date=15 April 2014 |url=http://rt.com/news/eastern-ukraine-army-operation-680/ |title=Kiev's bloody eastern Ukraine campaign LIVE UPDATES (August 14) |work=[[RT (TV network)|RT]] |accessdate=17 August 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140813015342/http://rt.com/news/eastern-ukraine-army-operation-680/ |archivedate=13 August 2014 |df=dmy }} ===Dmytrivka=== On 3 August, a Ukrainian [[Su-25]] jet was shot down near [[Dmytrivka, Donetsk Oblast|Dmytrivka]], but the pilot safely ejected from his plane.{{cite news|date=3 August 2014 |accessdate=6 August 2014 |url=http://en.ria.ru/military_news/20140803/191674767/Donetsk-Militia-Says-Ukrainian-Su-25-Fighter-Plane-Shot-Down.html |title=Donetsk Militia Says Ukrainian Su-25 Fighter Plane Shot Down |agency=[[RIA Novosti]] |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140804215918/http://en.ria.ru/military_news/20140803/191674767/Donetsk-Militia-Says-Ukrainian-Su-25-Fighter-Plane-Shot-Down.html |archivedate=4 August 2014 |df=dmy }} ===Savur-Mohyla=== [[File:Snezhnoe 060.jpg|thumb|right|The strategic hill Savur-Mohyla, as seen from Snizhne. Insurgents used the hill to shell government positions in Marynivka]] [[Savur-Mohyla]] is a strategically important hill near the [[Russo-Ukrainian border]], and overlooks the villages of Dmytrivka and Marynivka. DPR-affiliated insurgents used the hill to shell the government-controlled village of Marynivka on 16 July, amidst an offensive by the insurgents on that village. In response, the [[Air Force of Ukraine]] attacked insurgents positions on the hill, whilst the insurgents tried to repel this attack by firing anti-aircraft guns at Air Force aeroplanes. Government forces near that were encircled near the hill tried to break out of encirclement and rout the insurgents on it.{{cite news|author= |title=Militia goes on offensive near outskirts of Donetsk - Ukrainian troops |url=http://voiceofrussia.com/news/2014_07_16/Militia-goes-on-offensive-near-outskirts-of-Donetsk-Ukrainian-troops-3694/ |work=The [[Voice of Russia]] |date=16 July 2014 |accessdate=3 August 2014 |archivedate=3 August 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140803182645/http://voiceofrussia.com/news/2014_07_16/Militia-goes-on-offensive-near-outskirts-of-Donetsk-Ukrainian-troops-3694/ |df=dmy }} Ukrainian [[fighter jets]] were shot down near the hill on 23 July. A report by the Ukrainian government said that the shoot-downs were caused by missiles fired from Russia. Insurgent commander [[Igor Girkin]] said that DPR fighters shot down one of the planes, and that the pilot ejected.{{cite news|author= |url=http://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/world/ukraine/article19720331/ |title=MH17: Two Ukrainian fighter jets shot down near crash site, Kiev says |newspaper=[[The Globe and Mail]] |place=Kiev |agency=Reuters |date=23 July 2014 |accessdate=4 August 2014 |archivedate=29 July 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140729050802/http://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/world/ukraine/article19720331/ |df=dmy }} Ukrainian forces said that they retook the hill on 28 July. As a result, a corridor was created to resupply units that were trapped nearby.{{cite news|author= |title=NSDC: ATO troops take control of Savur-Mohyla hill at the border between Luhansk and Donetsk oblasts |accessdate=4 August 2014 |url=http://uacrisis.org/rnbo-5/ |publisher=[[Ukraine Crisis Media Center]] |date=28 July 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140729100716/http://uacrisis.org/rnbo-5/ |archivedate=29 July 2014 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }} Intense fighting in the area continued on 31 July.{{cite news|url=http://en.itar-tass.com/world/743106 |title=Ukrainian army intensifies offensive on Donetsk |date=31 July 2014 |agency=ITAR-TASS |accessdate=26 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140731232623/http://en.itar-tass.com/world/743106 |archivedate=31 July 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy }} Insurgents attacked Ukrainian positions on the hill from the nearby city of Snizhne on 5 August.{{cite news|url=http://euromaidanpress.com/2014/08/06/anti-terrorist-operation-summary-for-august-5-2014/ |title=Anti-Terrorist operation: Summary for August 5, 2014 |work=Euromadian Press |accessdate=11 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140812203236/http://euromaidanpress.com/2014/08/06/anti-terrorist-operation-summary-for-august-5-2014/ |archivedate=12 August 2014 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }} A spokesman for the [[National Security and Defence Council of Ukraine]] said on 6 August that Ukrainian forces on Savur-Mohyla had come into contact with pro-Russian insurgents twenty-five times in the past twenty-four hours.{{cite news|url=http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/217157.html |title=Ukrainian military encircle areas controlled by militants |date=6 August 2014 |agency=[[Interfax-Ukraine]] |accessdate=10 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140903095347/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/217157.html |archivedate=3 September 2014 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }} Amidst a wide counter-offensive by insurgents forces across the [[Donbass]] on 26 August, [[Savur-Mohyla]] was recaptured by DPR-affiliated forces.[http://en.itar-tass.com/world/746704 Donetsk militia claims assuming control of border stretch to Azov Sea], ITAR-TASS, 26 August 2014{{cite news|url=http://in.reuters.com/article/2014/08/28/ukraine-crisis-russia-soldiers-idINKBN0GS0X220140828 |last1=Balmforth |first1=Richard |last2=Polityuk |first2=Pavel |title=Ukraine accuses Russia of launching invasion |agency=[[Reuters]] |date=28 August 2014 |accessdate=28 August 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140903101447/http://in.reuters.com/article/2014/08/28/ukraine-crisis-russia-soldiers-idINKBN0GS0X220140828 |archivedate=3 September 2014 |df=dmy }} ===Malaysia Airlines Flight 17=== {{main|Malaysia Airlines Flight 17}} [[Malaysia Airlines Flight 17]] was a scheduled international passenger flight from [[Amsterdam]] to [[Kuala Lumpur]] that was shot down using a Buk surface-to-air missile near [[Hrabove, Donetsk Oblast|Hrabove]], about {{convert|10|km|mi|frac=4}} from [[Shakhtarsk]], on 17 July. All 283 passengers and 15 crew died in the shoot-down. ===Shakhtarsk=== [[File:Burning apartment building in Shahtersk, August 3, 2014.jpg|thumb|Burning block of flats in Shakhtarsk, 3 August 2014]] According to DPR forces, a [[National Guard of Ukraine|National Guard]] convoy entered Shakhtarsk from the north on 27 July. Air raid sirens were heard, heavy fighting erupted, and street battles took place across the city.{{Cite news|url = http://en.ria.ru/world/20140727/191358785/Ukraines-Tank-Convoy-Enters-Eastern-City-of-Shakhtarsk.html|title = Ukraine’s Tank Convoy Enters Eastern City of Shakhtarsk, Battles Underway – Militia|last = |first = |date = July 27, 2014|work = RIA NOVOSTI|accessdate = }} Insurgents attacked government forces from the south, but later retreated. Reinforcements from neighbouring Snizhne arrived to assist the embattled DPR insurgents.{{Cite news|url = http://www.interpretermag.com/ukraine-liveblog-day-160-the-battle-for-the-donbass-intensifies/|title = Ukraine Liveblog Day 160: The Battle For The Donbass Intensifies|last = |first = |date = |work = |accessdate = }} Subsequently, the [[Armed Forces of Ukraine]] said that they had captured [[Shakhtarsk]].{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-28599315 |title=Ukraine MH17: Air crash team finds human remains |date=1 August 2014 |work=[[BBC News]] |accessdate=6 August 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140810202045/http://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-28599315 |archivedate=10 August 2014 |df=dmy }} Two days later, however, the DPR-affiliated insurgents said they had reasserted control over the city, and pushed Ukrainian forces to its outskirts. They also said that a large amount of Ukrainian equipment was destroyed in the fighting.{{cite news|url=http://en.itar-tass.com/world/742851 |title=Militias fight Ukrainian troops in advance on eastern city |date=1 August 2014 |accessdate=21 August 2014 |agency=ITAR-TASS |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811063742/http://en.itar-tass.com/world/742851 |archivedate=11 August 2014 |df=dmy }} An insurgent ambush killed ten Ukrainian soldiers on 31 July.{{cite news|author= |title=Ukraine conflict: Investigators start search at MH17 jet crash site |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/world/ukraine-conflict-investigators-start-search-at-mh17-jet-crash-site-1.2724730 |website=[[CBC.ca]] |agency=[[CBC News]] |date=1 August 2014 |accessdate=3 August 2014 |archivedate=11 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811082328/http://www.cbc.ca/news/world/ukraine-conflict-investigators-start-search-at-mh17-jet-crash-site-1.2724730 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }} According to Ukrainian officials, mortars were used to attack the troops as they were re-deploying. Fierce clashes between government and insurgent forces continued in early August. Many civilians left their homes to escape the fighting, and whilst those that remained became emotionally distressed because of constant overnight artillery bombardment. [[Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe]] (OSCE) monitors visited Shakhtarsk on 8 August.{{cite press release|accessdate=10 August 2014 |url=http://www.osce.org/ukraine-smm/122495 |title=Latest from OSCE Special Monitoring Mission (SMM) to Ukraine based on information received by 18:00 (Kyiv time), 7 August 2014 |publisher=Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe |date=9 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140810193920/http://www.osce.org/ukraine-smm/122495 |deadurl=no |archivedate=10 August 2014 |df=dmy }} They said that the town was "deserted", and that no shops were open. According to local residents, water was only available for two hours a day, and electrical power and gas service were non-existent. There was damage from shelling across the town, and multiple residential buildings were seen destroyed. Insurgents fended off continued attempts by government forces in late August to remove them from Shakhtarsk.{{cite news|url=http://www.courrierinternational.com/article/2014/08/29/les-separatistes-determines-a-prendre-marioupol |title=Les séparatistes déterminés à prendre Marioupol |trans_title=The separatists are determined to take Mariupol |work=Courrier International |date=29 August 2014 |accessdate=31 August 2014 |language=fr |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140903084824/http://www.courrierinternational.com/article/2014/08/29/les-separatistes-determines-a-prendre-marioupol |archivedate=3 September 2014 |df=dmy }} ===Snizhne and Torez=== [[File:Damaged building in Snizhne, August 6, 2014.jpg|thumb|Damaged building in Snizhne, 6 August 2014]] [[Snizhne]] and [[Torez]] are cities that are geographically located in the Shakhtarsk Raion, but which are administered separately. Violence had occurred in Snizhne prior to the battle, including a rocket attack by an aeroplane on 15 July that killed at least eleven people and damaged many homes.{{cite news|author= |title=Ukraine conflict: Jet bombs rebel-held town of Snizhne |url=http://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-28309034 |work=BBC News |date=15 July 2014 |accessdate=7 August 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140729192522/http://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-28309034 |archivedate=29 July 2014 |df=dmy }} Ukrainian forces said they entered Torez and other nearby villages on 28 July.{{cite news|author= |title=ATO forces take over Debaltseve, Shakhtarsk, Torez, Lutuhyne, fighting for Pervomaisk and Snizhne underway - ATO press center |agency=Interfax-Ukraine |url=http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/215712.html |date=28 July 2014 |accessdate=8 August 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140728192109/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/215712.html |archivedate=28 July 2014 |df=dmy }} They managed to hold the town only briefly, as DPR-affiliated insurgents forced them to withdraw from the area on 1 August.{{cite news|url=http://en.itar-tass.com/world/743282 |title=DNR: Ukrainian army suffers crushing defeat near Shakhtarsk |date=1 August 2014 |agency=ITAR-TASS |accessdate=21 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811094037/http://en.itar-tass.com/world/743282 |archivedate=11 August 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy }} Clashes on the outskirts of the city continued on 7 August, after Ukrainian soldiers tried to relieve their encircled comrades near the town. According to the DPR, these attacks were repelled.{{cite news|author= |title=Kiev's bloody eastern Ukraine campaign LIVE UPDATES |url=http://rt.com/news/eastern-ukraine-army-operation-680/ |work=RT |date=7 August 2014 |accessdate=8 August 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140728220821/http://rt.com/news/eastern-ukraine-army-operation-680/ |archivedate=28 July 2014 |df=dmy }} Ukrainian forces advanced toward Torez again on 8 August, in an effort to present insurgent attacks on their positions at [[Savur-Mohyla]].{{cite news|url=http://euromaidanpress.com/2014/08/09/anti-terrorist-operation-in-ukraine-summary-for-august-8-2014/ |title=Anti-Terrorist Operation in Ukraine: summary for August 8, 2014 |accessdate=10 August 2014 |last=Burko |first=Roman |work=Euromadian Press |archivedate=9 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140809114353/http://euromaidanpress.com/2014/08/09/anti-terrorist-operation-in-ukraine-summary-for-august-8-2014/ |deadurl=no |df=dmy }} Ukrainian forces launched a new offensive with the aim of recapturing Snizhne, Torez and Shakhtarsk on 12 August. Clashes continued in each city.{{cite news|url=http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/217912.html |title=Kyiv says Ukraine army preparing offensive on Shakhtarsk, Torez and Snizhne |date= |agency=Interfax-Ukraine |accessdate=12 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140812211816/http://en.interfax.com.ua/news/general/217912.html |archivedate=12 August 2014 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }} On the next day, Ukrainian artillery destroyed a convoy of lorries filled with ammunition for the insurgents at Snizhne. According to two members of the Russian Presidential Human Rights Council, this convoy had been escorted by Russian military personnel, of which more than 100 were killed and about 300 wounded.{{cite news|last1=Grove |first1=Thomas |title=Exclusive: Over 100 Russian soldiers killed in single Ukraine battle - Russian rights activists |url=https://news.yahoo.com/over-100-russian-soldiers-killed-eastern-ukraine-russian-155412872.html |accessdate=28 August 2014 |agency=Reuters |work=Yahoo! News |date=28 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140905000058/https://news.yahoo.com/over-100-russian-soldiers-killed-eastern-ukraine-russian-155412872.html |archivedate=5 September 2014 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }} Government forces tried once again to retake Torez from the insurgents on 20 August, but were repelled.{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-28866283 |title=Ukraine conflict: Fierce battle for town of Ilovaisk |date=20 August 2014 |work=BBC News |accessdate=31 August 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140821012048/http://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-28866283 |archivedate=21 August 2014 |df=dmy }} Ukrainian forces destroyed eleven Grad rocket systems, three tanks, and five armoured vehicles used by the insurgents in Snizhne on 21 August. Government sources said that they also killed more than 100 Russian "mercenaries".{{cite news|accessdate=22 August 2014 |date=22 August 2014 |url=http://ukraineinvestigation.com/ukrainian-military-destroyed-11-terrorists-grads-near-snizhne/ |title=Ukrainian Military Destroyed 11 Terrorists' "Grad"s Near Snizhne |work=Ukraine Investagation |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140824025011/http://ukraineinvestigation.com/ukrainian-military-destroyed-11-terrorists-grads-near-snizhne/ |archivedate=24 August 2014 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }} ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} {{2014 pro-Russian conflict in Ukraine}} {{coord missing}} [[Category:Battles of the war in Donbass]] [[Category:2014 in Ukraine]] [[Category:History of Donetsk Oblast]] [[Category:Donetsk People's Republic]] [[Category:Conflicts in 2014]]
